title: US and Russia agree to re-establish military dialogue after Ukraine peace talks in Abu Dhabi
content: The US and Russia have agreed to resume military communications hotlines following talks in Abu Dhabi. The move comes as Washington continues to intensify diplomatic efforts to end the war in Ukraine, nearing its fourth anniversary.

title: Council of Europe chief calls for political and financial backing of Ukraine Special Tribunal
content: The head of Europe’s leading human rights organisation, the Council of Europe, told Euronews that European countries need to provide the budgetary resources and political will to ensure accountability for Russian war crimes committed in Ukraine.

title: Make the Saving and Investment Union a reality, Calviño tells EU leaders
content: The European Investment Bank president's intervention comes ahead of the Informal European Council in mid-February.

title: Ukraine peace deal without Kyiv would shatter Western credibility, Warsaw mayor tells Euronews
content: In an interview with Euronews, Warsaw mayor Rafał Trzaskowski warned that ending Russia's war in Ukraine without Kyiv’s full consent would undermine Western unity and embolden authoritarian regimes worldwide.

title: Push to review ECHR over migration could set dangerous precedent, CoE boss says
content: The head of Europe's leading human rights organisation warned that reviewing human rights to deal with migration challenges could become a Pandora's box.

title: EIB to frontload €3bn to mitigate impact of EU's carbon tax on road transport and buildings
content: The new funds come on top of €4 billion frontloaded to the Social Climate Fund, meaning a total of €7 billion will be available for EU countries before 2028.

title: Watch the video: €90 billion loan for Ukraine — how will it help?
content: EU locks in a €90bn Ukraine package for defence and public services, with opt-outs, "pay to play" access for UK firms and a fast-track Parliament vote.

title: Priced out: Why are so many Winter Olympic athletes asking for financial support?
content: European and international athletes have been forced to resort to GoFundMe to finance eye-watering equipment, travel and ticket costs.

title: EU, US and Japan to cooperate on critical raw materials supply chains
content: The joint arrangement will focus on boosting demand and diversifying the supply of critical raw materials by identifying and backing projects in mining, refining, and recycling, all with the goal of reducing reliance on China.

title: Newsletter: Macron edges Europe towards re-engaging Russia
content: Also in this newsletter: Latvian PM and Estonian President back EU envoy for Ukraine-Russia talks, and Brussels cautions member states over social media crackdowns.

title: Europe Today: EU seals €90 billion loan for Ukraine as Putin's diplomatic isolation deepens
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Melting ice, rising risks: Why Europe and NATO are racing to defend the Arctic
content: Western allies lack military capabilities that can withstand the harsh conditions of the Arctic and keep Russia in check in an area that spans about 4% of the Earth's surface.

title: Can the EU replicate Estonia’s startup success?
content: Estonia is one of the EU’s most business-friendly countries. But its success raises an uncomfortable question in Brussels: if this works so well there, why does the EU still struggle to start borderless businesses?

title: Can a social media ban protect children from online violence and bullying?
content: In this week’s episode of The Ring, MEPs Axel Voss (EPP) and Christel Schaldemose (Socialists) engage in a deep debate over whether or not a ban on social media for under-16's is a good thing.

title: EU must bolster defence and 'not test Article 5', Estonian President tells Euronews
content: The Estonian President told Euronews that Europe must bolster its own defence capabilities so as to "not test Article 5" of NATO. He added the bloc has long been "naive" about its security.

title: EU Parliament to hold extraordinary plenary session on anniversary of Ukraine invasion
content: The session will also see MEPs approve a €90bn loan to Kyiv funded with joint debt to keep Ukraine's war effort going.

title: European Parliament unfreezes EU-US trade deal
content: EU lawmakers on Wednesday agreed to resume enforcement of the EU-US trade deal. Talks will continue over how the agreement could be suspended in the future, but MEPs could vote on the deal as early as March.

title: EU countries seal deal on €90 billion loan for Ukraine, funded through joint debt
content: Under the special loan, Ukraine will receive €30 billion to support its budgetary needs and €60 billion to purchase weapons and ammunition.

title: Europe in the Epstein files: How far is the continent's political elite implicated?
content: The release of more than three million extra documents related to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has prompted resignations, accusations and a wave of online vitriol towards members of Europe’s political elite. But who is actually named in the files, and to what extent?

title: Europeans see wars and disinformation as top concerns, Eurobarometer survey finds
content: Europeans are most worried about wars near EU borders and disinformation, and want the European Parliament to tackle inflation, jobs and defence, according to the latest survey published Wednesday.

title: Russia's war in Ukraine: Are AI chatbots censoring the truth?
content: Europeans are increasingly turning to chatbots for answers to their most pressing questions about global conflicts. But can AI-generated responses be trusted, or do they spread misinformation?

title: Latvian PM and Estonian president back special EU envoy for Russia-Ukraine talks
content: Latvian Prime Minister Evika Siliņa and Estonian President Alar Karis have voiced support for the idea of appointing a special European envoy to take part in talks with the Kremlin to end its war in Ukraine.

title: Brussels cautions EU countries against overstepping with social media crackdowns
content: A European Commission spokesperson has said that additional national obligations on social media platforms are a “no go” under the bloc's own sweeping digital rulebook.

title: What is ICE's mandate abroad and can it operate on foreign soil?
content: Experts say that while the US immigration agency’s principal criminal investigative arm, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI), has operated abroad for many years, its activities are formally subject to the approval of host governments.

title: Russia 'choosing to attack soft targets', Moldova's foreign affairs minister tells Euronews
content: In an interview for Euronews' flagship morning show Europe Today, Mihai Popșoi voiced cautious faith in US-led Ukraine peace talks, condemned Russia’s attacks and emphasised Moldova’s 2028 EU membership bid.

title: Watch the video: EU-UK relationship — friends with benefits?
content: We are not seeing a full reunion. Instead, we are seeing a patchwork relationship. So the two are friendly enough to have dinner together. But strictly split the bill. And no sharing dessert.

title: Von der Leyen to travel to Australia to seal trade deal
content: The Commission president hopes to break the deadlock on an agreement that has been stalled since 2023.

title: Privacy push: Where do Europeans restrict access to their personal data the most?
content: EU internet users are taking more action to protect their personal data online. As new data shows rising resistance to online tracking, how far is the EU willing to go to reclaim digital sovereignty?

title: Newsletter: Ukraine peace talks resume as Macron signals groundwork for talks with Putin
content: Also in this newsletter: EU and Australia close in on free trade deal, why the digital euro is at a gridlock, and the EU and UK look set to tighten ties.

title: EU Inc: Brussels’ plan for a single company law across Europe
content: The European Commission wants to coexist with 27 national company laws with a single EU-wide rulebook. The goal is faster growth, lower costs, and more startups staying in Europe. Watch the video.

title: Europe Today: Russia strikes Kyiv as peace talks continue in Abu Dhabi
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: Paraguay President tells Euronews ‘Mercosur must be applied without delay’
content: In an interview with Euronews, Santiago Peña warned that delaying the implementation of the hard-won trade deal would be a "mistake".

title: Exclusive: Digital euro faces political deadlock in Brussels
content: The EU's proposal for a digital form of cash cannot proceed unless the European Parliament is able to agree on a position.

title: Von der Leyen convenes seminar to address competitiveness and 'frustrations'
content: Two commission officials indicated that the "seminar" on competitiveness will also address the Commission’s “working methods”.

title: Europeans 'would do well listening to Mario Draghi,' OECD chief tells Euronews
content: OECD chief says appetite for multilateral trade remains strong despite tariffs. Cormann says Europe should take note of recommendations laid out by former ECB president Mario Draghi to maintain 'success story' of the EU.

title: EU and UK to ramp up talks on closer ties 10 years after Brexit referendum
content: A volatile geopolitical context has spurred the European Union and United Kingdom to deepen their collaboration on areas including defence and trade after a fraught decade.

title: Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics: Which sports do Europeans prefer?
content: The upcoming Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics are expected to further boost Europe's winter sports economy, although high costs are increasingly becoming a barrier for snow lovers.

title: Fact check: Is Elon Musk allowing Russia to use Starlink to attack Ukraine?
content: Claims that Russian forces are increasingly accessing Starlink in Ukraine have prompted questions about how the technology works and why restricting access is complex.

title: Watch the video: All that glitters is not gold?
content: Gold is seen as a shield, protecting your savings as the value of paper money declines over time. Do you remember when your espresso cost you €1? Good luck getting one at this price in Brussels today.

title: Euronews records best ever January audience performance
content: Euronews has recorded its best-ever January for digital engagement, with 113 million page views and 13.6 million video views. Following a record-breaking 2025, the results underscore the network’s strategic shift toward original, pan-European reporting and its growing dominance in EU news coverage.

title: Newsletter: 'Super Mario' returns at another moment of European economic reckoning
content: Also in this newsletter: why European leaders are flocking to Beijing amid transatlantic tensions, the latest on Ukraine peace efforts, and the French budget is adopted after months of political gridlock.

title: Europe Today: Global gathering in Dubai on AI, trade and geopolitics
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme, Europe Today, at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.

title: What is EU-INC and its plan to make European businesses borderless?
content: Ursula von der Leyen announced the EU-INC, promising a 48-hour digital incorporation framework to unify Europe’s fragmented market.

title: EU-China relations enter 'do no harm' phase as Trump's shadow looms
content: Last year, the EU and China flirted with a diplomatic reset, which collapsed after Beijing imposed broad restrictions on rare earth exports. That bruising experience has set the stage for a cautious engagement in 2026.

title: Germany opposes direct talks with Russia due to Putin's 'maximalist demands'
content: As Paris and Rome push for reopening diplomatic channels with Moscow, Berlin is taking the opposite position.

title: EU's climate goals at risk without China's critical raw materials, EU auditors warn
content: Despite the EU's ongoing efforts to diversify supply chains, Chinese materials are crucial for the bloc's climate transition. China accounts for 60% of global production of critical raw materials and 90% of refining capacity.

title: Watch the video: Kyiv is freezing — would you survive in -20C without heating?
content: Can you imagine starting your week in -20C? Here in Brussels, a power cut is an inconvenience. In Kyiv right now, it is a matter of survival. And severely cold weather has become a weapon just as powerful as any missile.

title: EU must become a 'genuine federation' to avoid deindustrialisation and decline, Draghi says
content: The former Italian prime minister said the European Union risks subordination, division and deindustrialision all at once if it does not pull closer together.

title: How can the EU keep its unicorns? Ask the Euronews AI chatbot
content: Ursula von der Leyen introduced the EU’s “28th Regime”, which would set up a pan-European market to make it easier for startups to form and operate across borders. If you want to learn more about how the EU plans to build its own Silicon Valley, ask the Euronews AI chatbot.

title: From classroom game to niche meme: How AI character Amelia spread across Europe
content: An AI character created for education has been transformed into a political meme spreading across Europe, largely associated with far-right and misleading narratives.

title: Petrol or electric? EVs are becoming more popular than fuel-powered cars in Europe
content: Whether motivated by climate concerns or generous subsidies, European drivers are changing how they buy cars. Electric and hybrid models are surging across the bloc, but which countries are powering ahead and why?

title: Donald Trump endorses Hungary's Viktor Orbán ahead of key elections
content: Trump has a history of supporting like-minded right-wing candidates on the campaign trail. Orbán is facing his most difficult election as the opposition Tisza Party led by young conservative Peter Magyar leads in opinion polls.

title: EU Parliament pushes for European preference in military mobility plan
content: MEP François Kalfon says that transport infrastructure would also benefit from a European preference, and that the bloc should jointly procure certain assets to facilitate the fast movement of troops and equipment.

title: Europe Today: US and Iran start nuclear talks amid ongoing tensions
content: Tune in to Euronews' new flagship morning programme at 8 am Brussels time. In just 20 minutes, we bring you up to speed on the biggest news of the day.
